column5: Pretty sure the minimum is 40...

http://www.tyeeclub.org/trophies.htm  Buttons are available for purchase by anglers who have taken a qualifying fish according to the Rules and Regulations of The Tyee Club of British Columbia. Members may purchase one button for each qualifying salmon. THE CLUB BUTTONS SHALL BE: BRONZE BUTTON for Tyee salmon weighing 30 pounds or over (but under 40 pounds) SILVER BUTTON for Tyee salmon weighing 40 pounds or over (but under 50 pounds) GOLD BUTTON for Tyee salmon weighing 50 pounds or over (but under 60 pounds) DIAMOND BUTTON for Tyee salmon weighing 60 pounds or over (but under 70 pounds) RUBY BUTTON for Tyee salmon weighing over 70 pounds TYEE MAN BUTTON for anglers who gain "Tyee Man" status for taking the largest Tyee of the season
OK, let me know when you get one over 40
This year ....  I WILL break the 50" Barrier.  I've been close on a few - but this year will be it. Maybe another goal would be to get out fishing more than one time this year back here at home.
double digit walleye 40+" musky double digit laker Another huge Northern (have one 43")
I'd like to get schools of bait fish murals painted on the bottom of my boats and see if that helps me this year.
16lbs out of the Notty is going to be a tough gig..   But the fun will be in trying and tossing back all those 4-5lb'rs!  LOL!
I thought of that last year and wondered if it would actually work.  Your sitting making a few cast and then all you hear is thump on the bottom of your boat.  Cool
I'd like to figure out the pike in the lower grand, 25" walleye, any size steelhead, also would npt mind a a brookie

Since the summer of 2009 I have not been able to weigh a largemouth over 6lbs, I've had several in the high 4lb-low 5lb range but am due for another. Booked a week off in June for camping and fishing and 2 full weeks in August. I'm sure I'll be in for a good season  And might even find that 6lb bucket I've been after.  Tightlines, Feburary, March, April, May and it's here...time will fly by

The smallmouth I lost last year lol.  40" Pike 50" Musky 15lb Brown hopefully over 20lbs same for Rainbow as brown. 30lb Chinook(Tyee) 15lb Walleye  Don't care much for my panfish as long as there big enough to keep.

well i got both me PB bass last summer a 5lb smallie and a 6.1 bucket so my mission is to top that again,i will have my work cut out for me as well again,and top my 20lb pike i got out of the ottawa river....last spring as well....cant wait
I'll just be happy to get out fishing after a forced 2 year lay off due to ankle problems. Any fish caught will be a bonus.
I have a deep heart felt desire to catch a bigger Sheep's Head then Spiel. HH

Possible 15" Crappie and Perch 22" Largie 21" Smallie 35" Pike  Always a challenge 45" muskie - Georgian Bay/Port Severn again 10 lb Walleye - Quinte in February My 1st whitefish - never targeted them before - maybe try Port Bolster area
Spiel is a world class Sheeps head man, the best I've ever seen at sight fishing these silver marvels... I want to be like him this year... no, strike that, I want/need to beat him! HH

Oh speaking of sheephead this one boarders possible and boarders wishfull thinking.  I'd like to see (I don't need to catch it) an Ontario record sheephead this year.  My buddy caught one last year that tips the scales at 15.5 pounds and he says on clear days he has seen bigger. I'd love to see one pushing 20+.
Here's your wish come true...one pushing 30 (27.5) Caught by Aaron Shirley. Scroll down to post #49  http://http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=47968&page=3
My goal this year is to simply have fun fishing with family and friends. In the process perhaps experience some different country and some new and exciting waters.
45" muskie isnt going to happen brother.  Sorry, but you had your chance and blew it.  Only if I was there instead of dad.  I would of jumped in and picked it up over my head and body slammed it.lol
Always about the one that got away...I hope you don't hide in the bow when I finally hook a Georgian Bay submarine this year.  I'll need a photographer and measure guy, thats you!!!  lol

Hey guys.  Just thought I would post a topic on what are going to be the big ones that I am going to catch this year.  My main goal is to catch at least a 20 inch bass.  Dont care if its smallmouth or largemouth.  Almost had it last year, but lost it right at the boat.  Im hoping to beat my pike record of 30 inches too.  I know thats small, but the lake I fish in doesnt have big ones.  Also I would like to beat my perch record of 12.5 inches.  Had a 12 this year at Cooks, so I was close.  What about you guys.
50 inch pike, 27in brookie, 30+ lb laker.
Still looking for a 16" perch, and a 40lb carp I can verify this time.
I'm looking for a 14.5" perch, a 16" brookie, a 35" pike, any muskie and a 15" crappie
Well a monster laker will be no. 1 on the list as soon as season opens, after that it'll be more about location than fish caught.

Winter target would be a whitefish that gets it's shoulders caught in a 6" hole  For spring, I'm looking for a 30lb carp (several high 20's over the last few years) and I'll also be trying to add a few on the centre pin. Be nice to do both together.  and about the only thing I really have a jones on for is a big rainbow out on the lake, something that'll nudge that 20lb mark (2 years ago I had a piggy on in out in the blue zone that was so fat it couldn't jump out of the water. All it did was get halfway and then fall back  - still haunted by those images as it threw the hook close to the boat)

I'd like to win 2 walleye tournaments this year... Out of the 4-5 ill end up entering... Last year we did 3 tournaments and placed 2nd 5th and 6th....  And I have 2 PBs that have been around too long... I wanna break 36.76lb on a carp and 53.5 inches on a musky....
I don't have any personal goals, I just want to generate more smiles like this on my boat...
12+ Lb Walleye, and my main goal this year is to catch 100+ pound sturgeon or one 8ft or longer.

Any Lake Trout Any Longnose Gar A girlfriend who likes fishing (not sure if thats related or not)  Ha ha for me although I like seeing big fish I want to catch some new stuff.  Oh also my buddy has what I'm guessing is an 80+ pound sturgeon under his dock at his cottage (Broke 30 pound braid like it was dental floss) we don't have to catch it, I'd just like to see it.
40" pike 50" musky 10lb walleye 6lb LMB/SMB any laker any whitefish 300 smelts

Get my wife a 50" musky casting Get my daughter her first casting musky Get my son more interested into fishing taking him with me early weekend mornings Take out more new people and enjoy the day fishing  Oh and for team 2 I want to remember my OFC 2013 sign more

That sounds ridiculous to most people hahaha.  I'd like: Lots of brookies from unexpected areas/creeks/lakes. Hoping to try lots of new and difficult to reach spots. (summer and spring)  A whitefish and a decent (+5lbs) laker would be nice this winter.  Plenty of walleye over 22". Already have 2.  Find a few more "secret" fishing spots and camping locations.  Hit the big lakes with somebody from this board for salmon or steelhead.
Sounds good!
Have a decent summer fishing for a change. Not too hot, just right for the fish.
14 pound walleye.  Best is 12 pounds 14 ounces that I got in December of this year.

I dunno, my buddies arn't too bright, when they hooked into it they tried pulling it off the bottom with all their might (Imagine a 250 pound guy trying to pull up a goliath grouper) the fish didn't even budge, just kept sweeping along the bottom at a laid back pace. Eventually the weight of my buddy + weight of fish snapped the line.

Lookin for a 6lb bass, 36"+ pike, any muskie, any carp. Maybe a 24"+ Walleye... but I don't seem to ever catch a walleye when I go looking for them... they just happen upon me whilst bassing. Any trouts......
Bigger fish than G-man this year Tyee. 40+ inch pike not necessarily in that order
A tyee out of lake O? I want to see this!
I want a 16+ pound buck out of the Notty. Catch a respectable trout on a fly in a small creek. Thrash with a nice pike on a fly as well.  Nail a 30+ pound laker out of simcoe . THIS IS POSSIBLE.
There's plenty caught each year. Tyee's are Chinook over 30lbs.  In BC, many clubs and resorts will hand out Tyee pins: 30-40 lbs Bronze 40-50 lbs Silver 50-60 lbs Gold 60+ Diamond

Lots of snow pack between now and end of March combined with heavy rains, for S Ontario. More time fishing than last year.  As for the fish, I'd like to catch either/both a brown and bow pushing 20lbs.  Have caught one of each that were close but not confirmed.

I imagine I'll slam perch, crappies, gills and big northerns through the ice. I'll spend spring catching giant catfish and carp, steelhead and crappies. In the summer I'll focus on trophy bass and pike worth catching (38" and up). Fall continues that, accompanied by big salmon and spring trout. Hope to get up for muskies and some bigger walleye this year at some point, as well as catch my first laker.
